page.title: 06PARTRIDGE GREEN EMPLOYMENT
page.content: AGRICULTURAL WORKERS are employed on the farms:ploughing,planting,harvesting, milking the dairy herd,rearing cattle and mending fences.The increase in the use of FARM MACHINERY however has meant fewer agricultural workers.In the village of Partridge Green most people use their own or firms transport to travel to either HORSHAM or CRAWLEY,notably GATWICK AIRPORT,to work.Some of the WOMEN work in one or other of the industrial estate factories.Village TRAFFIC increases between 8 and 8.30 in the morning and 5 and 6.00 in the evening."FLEXI-TIME" helps to relieve traffic jams.People may start work at any time between 8 and 9.30am.and finish at any time between 4 and 6.00pm.providing that a basic 35/37 hour week is worked.
